trans-unit.source: Represents the data in a SOAP request or SOAP response at a specific <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage"></xref>.
The primary use of the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessage> class is for SOAP extensions, representing the data in a SOAP request or SOAP response.

When the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapExtension.ProcessMessage%2A> method is called, a <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapExtension> receives a <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessage> at each <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage>.
It is up to the particular SOAP extension to choose how to process the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessage>.
Common SOAP extensions include encryption and compression.
SOAP extensions can be applied to either or both an XML Web service method created using ASP.NET or an XML Web service client.

When a SOAP extension is applied to an XML Web service method, the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapExtension.ProcessMessage%2A> method receives an instance of <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapServerMessage>, which derives from <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessage>.

Likewise, when a SOAP extension is applied to an XML Web service client, <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapExtension.ProcessMessage%2A> receives an instance of <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapClientMessage>.
When overridden in a derived class, gets the SOAPAction HTTP request header field for the SOAP request or SOAP response.
The <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessage.Action%2A> property can be accessed during any <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage>.
The SOAPAction HTTP request header field for the SOAP request or SOAP response.
Gets or sets the contents of the `Content-Encoding` HTTP header.

A SOAP extension can set the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessage.ContentEncoding%2A> property to provide supplementary information about the encoding of a SOAP message without changing the media type as expressed in the `Content-Type` HTTP header.
The contents of the `Content-Encoding` HTTP header.

The current <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage"></xref> is <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage.AfterSerialize"></xref> or <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage.AfterDeserialize"></xref> stages.
Gets or sets the HTTP `Content-Type` of the SOAP request or SOAP response.

The <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessage.ContentType%2A> property can only be accessed in the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage.BeforeSerialize> and <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage.BeforeDeserialize> stages; otherwise, an <xref:System.InvalidOperationException> is thrown.

Use the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessage.ContentEncoding%2A> property, instead of the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessage.ContentType%2A> property to provide supplementary information about the encoding of a SOAP message.
The HTTP `Content-Type` of the SOAP request or SOAP response.
The default is "text/xml".

<xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessage.ContentType"></xref> is accessed <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage.AfterSerialize"></xref> or <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage.AfterDeserialize"></xref> stages.
When overridden in a derived class, asserts that the current <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage"></xref> is a stage where in parameters are available.
The asserted stage is different for XML Web service clients and XML Web service methods.
An XML Web service method's in parameters are available after the SOAP request is deserialized in the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage.AfterDeserialize> stage.
For an XML Web service client, the in parameters are available prior to the SOAP request serialization process in the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage.BeforeSerialize> stage.

<xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessage.EnsureInStage%2A> can be called during any <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage>, however an <xref:System.InvalidOperationException> is thrown when in parameters are not available.
In parameters are not available.
When overridden in a derived class, asserts that the current <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage"></xref> stage is a stage where out parameters are available.
The asserted stage is different for XML Web service clients and XML Web service methods.
An XML Web service method's out parameters are available prior to the SOAP response serialization process in the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage.BeforeSerialize> stage.
In an XML Web service client, the out parameters are available after the SOAP response deserialization process in the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage.AfterDeserialize> stage.

<xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessage.EnsureOutStage%2A> can be called during any <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage>, however an <xref:System.InvalidOperationException> is thrown when out parameters are not available.
Out parameters are not available.
Ensures that the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage"></xref> of the call to the XML Web service method is the stage or stages passed in.
If the current processing stage is not one of the stages passed in, an exception is thrown.
Multiple stages can be asserted by performing a bitwise OR operation on multiple instances of the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage> class.
<xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessage.EnsureStage%2A> can be called during any <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage>.
The <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage"></xref> asserted.
The current <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage"></xref> is not the asserted stage or stages.
Gets the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapException"></xref> from the call to the XML Web service method.
The <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessage.Exception%2A> property can be accessed during any <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage>.
The <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapException"></xref> that occurred in the call to the XML Web service method.
`null` if no <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapException"></xref> has occurred during the call to the Web Sevice method.
Gets the parameter passed into the XML Web service method at the specified index.
The <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessage.GetInParameterValue%2A> property is only accessible when in parameters are available.
ASP.NET throws <xref:System.InvalidOperationException> when accessing the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessage.GetInParameterValue%2A> property if in parameters are not available.

In a <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapClientMessage> the in parameters are available in the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage.BeforeSerialize><xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage>.

In a <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapServerMessage> the in parameters are available in the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage.AfterDeserialize><xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage>.
The zero-based index of the parameter in the array of parameters.
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> representing the parameter at the specified index.
The index parameter is less than 0 or greater than the length of the parameters array.
Accessing this property when in parameters are not available.
Gets the out parameter passed into the XML Web service method at the specified index.
If out parameters are not available, ASP.NET throws an <xref:System.InvalidOperationException> when accessing the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessage.GetOutParameterValue%2A> property.

In a <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapClientMessage> the out parameters are available in the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage.AfterDeserialize><xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage>.

In a <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapServerMessage> the out parameters are available in the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage.BeforeSerialize> of the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage>.
The zero-based index of the parameter in the array of parameters.
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> representing the parameter at the specified index.
The index parameter is greater than the length of the parameters array.
Accessing this property when out parameters are not available.
Gets the return value of an XML Web service method.
If a return value is not available, ASP.NET throws <xref:System.InvalidOperationException> when accessing the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessage.GetReturnValue%2A> property.

In a <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapClientMessage> the return value is available when the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage> value is <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage.AfterDeserialize>.

In a <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapServerMessage> the return value is available when <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage> value is <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage.BeforeSerialize>.
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> representing the return value of the XML Web service method.
The XML Web service method does not have a return value.
OR
The return value is not available.
A collection of the SOAP headers applied to the current SOAP request or SOAP response.
SOAP headers are an optional portion of a SOAP request or SOAP response.
For more details on using SOAP headers in XML Web services created using ASP.NET and their clients, see the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapHeader> class.

Although the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessage.Headers%2A> property can be accessed at any stage, it is only populated with the SOAP header information in the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage.BeforeSerialize> and <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage.AfterDeserialize> stages.
A <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapHeaderCollection"></xref> of the SOAP headers applied to the current SOAP request or SOAP response.
`null`, if there are no SOAP headers.
When overridden in a derived class, gets a representation of the method prototype for the XML Web service method for which the SOAP request is intended.

Although <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessage.MethodInfo%2A> can be accessed during any <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage>, it only has data during <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage.AfterDeserialize> and <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage.BeforeSerialize>.
A <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.LogicalMethodInfo"></xref> representing the XML Web service method for which the SOAP request is intended.

Gets a value indicating the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapDocumentMethodAttribute.OneWay"></xref> property of either the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapDocumentMethodAttribute"></xref> or the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapRpcMethodAttribute"></xref> attribute applied to the XML Web service method.

See the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapDocumentMethodAttribute.OneWay%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property of <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapDocumentMethodAttribute> or <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapRpcMethodAttribute> for details about one-way XML Web service methods.
The <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessage.OneWay%2A> property is accessible in all stages of <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage>.

`true` if the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapDocumentMethodAttribute.OneWay"></xref> property of the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapDocumentMethodAttribute"></xref> or <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapRpcMethodAttribute"></xref> applied to the XML Web service method is `true`; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the version of the SOAP protocol used to communicate with the XML Web service.

For a <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapServerMessage>, the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapServerMessage.SoapVersion%2A> property is guaranteed to be valid after the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage.BeforeDeserialize> stage.

In the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage.BeforeDeserialize> stage the property is available, however the SOAP message has not been completely processed and SOAP extensions that may alter the contents of the SOAP message have not run.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapProtocolVersion"></xref> values.
The default is <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapProtocolVersion.Default"></xref>.
Gets the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage"></xref> of the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessage"></xref>.
The <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessage.Stage%2A> property can be accessed at any <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage>.
The <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage"></xref> of the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessage"></xref>.
Gets the data representing the SOAP request or SOAP response in the form of a <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref>.

SOAP extensions that inspect the data representing a SOAP request or SOAP response, such as a logging SOAP extension, can use the `Stream` property to view the data at each <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage>.

SOAP extensions that modify the data representing a SOAP request or SOAP response, such as encryption or compression SOAP extensions, should do so with the <xref:System.IO.Stream> passed into the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapExtension.ChainStream%2A> method of <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapExtension>.

The <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessage.Stream%2A> property of <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessage> passed into <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapExtension.ProcessMessage%2A> is read-only.
For more information on modifying the data representing a SOAP request or SOAP response, see <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapExtension.ChainStream%2A>.
A read-only instance of the <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref> class.
When overridden in a derived class, gets the base URL of the XML Web service.
The <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessage.Url%2A> property can be accessed during any <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage>.
The base URL of the XML Web service.
